text.tspan: The color of the path changes to green.
The extension has been installed.
New pages and stops can still be added.
Making Slides in Inkscape with Inkslides
1 Create a control layer.
2 Mark Slide Pages
3 Define the sequence of slides
4 Select the path, then
apply Extensions :: Set up Inkslides
5 Save and play the file in a browser.
Rectangles and Paths in the control layer decides
how the slides are played.
The control layer is hidden automatically.
In this example, the gray rectangles and the blue
path are drawn on the control layer.
Pages are marked with rectanges.
Pages can overlap.
When a page is played, the content within the slide
page is displayed.
Any content that is outside the page is clipped.
The sequence is defined by a path
Each node on the play path marks a stop.
At a stop, the smallest slide page
enclosing the stop is displayed.
To switch between stops, use
Arrow Keys, Home, End, Page Up / Down
